T1190.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
T1190.description: Adversaries may attempt to exploit a weakness in an Internet-facing host or system.
T1190.detection: Monitor application logs for exploitation attempts. WAF logs can reveal exploitation patterns.

T1133.name: External Remote Services
T1133.description: Remote services such as VPNs, Citrix, and other access mechanisms allow users to connect to internal enterprise network resources.
T1133.detection: Monitor for unusual VPN connections, especially from unexpected geographic locations.

T1566.name: Phishing
T1566.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems.
T1566.detection: Monitor email for suspicious attachments and links. Track email security alerts.

T1078.name: Valid Accounts
T1078.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts.
T1078.detection: Monitor for suspicious login patterns and credential usage.

T1059.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter
T1059.description: Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands.
T1059.detection: Monitor process execution, especially PowerShell, CMD, and bash activity.

T1203.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
T1203.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities in client applications.
T1203.detection: Monitor for crashes and unusual application behavior.

T1204.name: User Execution
T1204.description: An adversary may rely upon user execution of malicious files.
T1204.detection: Monitor for execution of suspicious files from unusual locations.

T1047.name: Windows Management Instrumentation
T1047.description: Adversaries may abuse WMI to execute malicious commands and payloads.
T1047.detection: Monitor WMI event logs and process creation via WMI.

T1053.name: Scheduled Task/Job
T1053.description: Adversaries may abuse task scheduling functionality.
T1053.detection: Monitor scheduled task creation and modification.

T1543.name: Create or Modify System Process
T1543.description: Adversaries may create or modify system-level processes.
T1543.detection: Monitor for new services and system process modifications.

T1547.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution
T1547.description: Adversaries may configure system settings to execute at system boot.
T1547.detection: Monitor registry run keys and startup folder modifications.

T1098.name: Account Manipulation
T1098.description: Adversaries may manipulate accounts to maintain access.
T1098.detection: Monitor for account modifications and permission changes.

T1136.name: Create Account
T1136.description: Adversaries may create an account to maintain access.
T1136.detection: Monitor for new account creation, especially privileged accounts.

T1068.name: Exploitation for Privilege Escalation
T1068.description: Adversaries may exploit software vulnerabilities to elevate privileges.
T1068.detection: Monitor for unusual privilege escalation and exploit attempts.

T1134.name: Access Token Manipulation
T1134.description: Adversaries may modify access tokens to elevate privileges.

T1055.name: Process Injection
T1055.description: Adversaries may inject code into processes.

T1070.name: Indicator Removal
T1070.description: Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts to remove evidence.
T1070.detection: Monitor for log clearing and file deletion activities.

T1027.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
T1027.description: Adversaries may obfuscate files or information to evade detection.
T1027.detection: Monitor for encoded/obfuscated scripts and payloads.

T1562.name: Impair Defenses
T1562.description: Adversaries may maliciously modify security tools.
T1562.detection: Monitor for security tool tampering and disablement.

T1218.name: System Binary Proxy Execution
T1218.description: Adversaries may bypass process and/or signature-based defenses.
T1218.detection: Monitor for unusual usage of system binaries.

T1036.name: Masquerading
T1036.description: Adversaries may manipulate file or process names to evade defenses.
T1036.detection: Monitor for files with misleading names or extensions.

T1110.name: Brute Force
T1110.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts.
T1110.detection: Monitor for multiple failed login attempts.

T1003.name: OS Credential Dumping
T1003.description: Adversaries may attempt to dump credentials from operating system.
T1003.detection: Monitor for LSASS access and credential dumping tools.

T1555.name: Credentials from Password Stores
T1555.description: Adversaries may search for credentials in password stores.
T1555.detection: Monitor access to credential managers and password stores.

T1056.name: Input Capture
T1056.description: Adversaries may use methods to capture user input.
T1056.detection: Monitor for keylogging software and activities.

T1087.name: Account Discovery
T1087.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of accounts.

T1083.name: File and Directory Discovery
T1083.description: Adversaries may enumerate files and directories.
T1083.detection: Monitor for file system enumeration activities.

T1135.name: Network Share Discovery
T1135.description: Adversaries may look for network shares.

T1046.name: Network Service Discovery
T1046.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of services running on remote hosts.
T1046.detection: Monitor for port scanning and service enumeration.

T1057.name: Process Discovery
T1057.description: Adversaries may attempt to get information about running processes.

T1018.name: Remote System Discovery
T1018.description: Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems.

T1082.name: System Information Discovery
T1082.description: An adversary may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system.
T1082.detection: Monitor for system information gathering commands.

T1021.name: Remote Services
T1021.description: Adversaries may use valid accounts to log into remote services.
T1021.detection: Monitor for unusual remote service connections.

T1210.name: Exploitation of Remote Services
T1210.description: Adversaries may exploit remote services to gain access.
T1210.detection: Monitor for exploitation attempts on remote services.

T1534.name: Internal Spearphishing
T1534.description: Adversaries may use internal spearphishing to gain access to additional systems.

T1005.name: Data from Local System
T1005.description: Adversaries may search local system sources for data.
T1005.detection: Monitor for unusual file access patterns.

T1039.name: Data from Network Shared Drive
T1039.description: Adversaries may search network shares for data.
T1039.detection: Monitor for unusual network share access.

T1113.name: Screen Capture
T1113.description: Adversaries may attempt to take screen captures.
T1113.detection: Monitor for screen capture tools and API calls.

T1560.name: Archive Collected Data
T1560.description: Adversaries may compress and/or encrypt data prior to exfiltration.
T1560.detection: Monitor for archiving activities and compression tools.

T1041.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
T1041.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over their command and control channel.
T1041.detection: Monitor for unusual data transfers over C2 channels.

T1048.name: Exfiltration Over Alternative Protocol
T1048.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an alternative protocol.
T1048.detection: Monitor for unusual protocol usage for data transfer.

T1567.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
T1567.description: Adversaries may use web services to exfiltrate data.
T1567.detection: Monitor for large uploads to external web services.

T1071.name: Application Layer Protocol
T1071.description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols.
T1071.detection: Monitor for unusual application protocol usage.

T1095.name: Non-Application Layer Protocol
T1095.description: Adversaries may use non-application layer protocols for C2.

T1573.name: Encrypted Channel
T1573.description: Adversaries may employ encryption to protect C2 communications.
T1573.detection: Monitor for encrypted channels to suspicious destinations.

T1090.name: Proxy
T1090.description: Adversaries may use proxies to disguise C2 traffic.
T1090.detection: Monitor for proxy usage and traffic redirection.

T1486.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
T1486.description: Adversaries may encrypt data to impact availability.
T1486.detection: Monitor for ransomware indicators and mass file encryption.

T1490.name: Inhibit System Recovery
T1490.description: Adversaries may delete or remove backup data.
T1490.detection: Monitor for backup deletion and shadow copy removal.

T1491.name: Defacement
T1491.description: Adversaries may modify content to deface internal or external systems.

T1485.name: Data Destruction
T1485.description: Adversaries may destroy data to impact availability.
T1485.detection: Monitor for mass file deletion activities.

T1498.name: Network Denial of Service
T1498.description: Adversaries may perform DoS attacks to degrade or block service availability.
T1498.detection: Monitor for unusual network traffic patterns.

T1489.name: Service Stop
T1489.description: Adversaries may stop or disable services.

TA0001.name: Initial Access
TA0001.description: The adversary is trying to get into your network.

TA0002.name: Execution
TA0002.description: The adversary is trying to run malicious code.

TA0003.name: Persistence
TA0003.description: The adversary is trying to maintain their foothold.

TA0004.name: Privilege Escalation
TA0004.description: The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.

TA0005.name: Defense Evasion
TA0005.description: The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.

TA0006.name: Credential Access
TA0006.description: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords.

TA0007.name: Discovery
TA0007.description: The adversary is trying to figure out your environment.

TA0008.name: Lateral Movement
TA0008.description: The adversary is trying to move through your environment.

TA0009.name: Collection
TA0009.description: The adversary is trying to gather data of interest.

TA0010.name: Exfiltration
TA0010.description: The adversary is trying to steal data.

TA0011.name: Command and Control
TA0011.description: The adversary is trying to communicate with compromised systems.

TA0040.name: Impact
TA0040.description: The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.
